Italy: Julian's Persian War: Roman forces embarked from Antioch on a punitive expedition against the Sasanian Empire. Battle of Samarra: Sasanian forces harassed a Roman army in retreat at Samarra from a failed siege of their capital Ctesiphon. Julian was killed. Julian's army declared one of their generals, Jovian (emperor), augustus. Julian's Persian War: Jovian agreed to cede the five provinces east of the Tigris to the Sasanian Empire, ending the war.
